title: 5 Wine Co. NV Red (California)
description: This is a nice, juicy wine that has interesting fruit and earth aromas, good ripe berry flavors and an easy-going texture. It feels medium bodied and tastes not too strong and not too weak.

title: Black's Station 2016 Chardonnay (Yolo County)
description: This full-bodied wine is loaded with aromas of pear nectar and grilled baguette, and very ripe fruit flavors. It has a warmly oaky personality, showing vanilla and coconut in addition to generous pear notes.

title: Conti Zecca 2014 Donna Marzia Negroamaro (Puglia)
description: A mix of black and red cherries carry the nose, with tobacco leaf and herbal spice tones in a more moderate concentration. There's levity to the mouthfeel from the crisp acidity and light, sandy tannins, yet the palate offers a good deal of racy fruit flavors that end clean and refreshing.

title: Corte Medicea 2015 Zotikos  (Bolgheri)
description: A blend of Merlot, Sangiovese, Cabernet Franc and Syrah, this has a shy nose that eventually reveals aromas of baking spice and black-skinned fruit. The straightforward palate offers sweet vanilla and cherry jam alongside round tannins.

title: Cantele 2014 Amativo Red (Salento)
description: A blend of 60% Primitivo and 40% Negroamaro, this shows a mix of spiced blackberry and cranberry aromas under a sheen of toasted oak. The medium-bodied palate is well structured with juicy acidity and medium-grained tannins, and is rounded out by soft, ripe berry flavors.

title: Cantine del Borgo Reale 2015 Maturo Red (Salento)
description: This blend of Primitivo and Negroamaro is linear in its expression of ripe cherry, baking spice and graphite. The medium-bodied palate starts juicy up front, but dries out as it reaches the tense, plum-skin finish.

title: Cedar + Salmon 2016 Pinot Noir (Willamette Valley)
description: Forward vivid scents of cranberry and raspberry introduce similar fresh fruit flavors, backed by slightly harsh notes of skin and stem. It's a sturdy serviceable effort, which finishes with a hint of chicken broth.

title: Domaine Rieflé-Landmann 2016 Pinot Blanc (Alsace)
description: Ripe and fruity notes of yellow Mirabelle plums make for an appetizing nose. The palate has a similarly rich impression but lacks a little direction and focus. There is plenty of fruit and lemon brightness. Drink soon.

title: Eugene Wine Cellars 2016 b2 Pinot Gris (Willamette Valley)
description: Here is a light, tart, all-stainless style of wine, with interesting phenolic flavors of pear skin and green apples. Juicy acids bring a citrus component into it as well. It's lively and fresh: a good all-purpose crisp white wine.

title: Giancarlo Ceci 2014 Parco Marano Nero di Troia (Castel del Monte)
description: High-toned cherry aromas meld with saw dust, anise and game on the nose of this pure expression of Nero di Troia. Light- to medium-bodied in style, flavors of savory bramble berries offer plenty of zip to the palate, with soft tannins giving just enough support. An herb-dusted cherry note marks the finish.

title: Golan Heights Winery 2016 Hermon Moscato (Galilee)
description: With aromas of white peach and honeysuckle, this wine has flavors of ripe peach, marzipan and orange blossom. It is sweet but not cloying, with a burst of refreshing brightness on the finish.

title: Goulée 2015  Médoc
description: This wine is rich, with superripe tannins and a barnyard character. It has structure but it mainly focuses on fruit and acidity. Made by the team at Cos d'Estournel, the wine has a rich structure and will be ready to drink soon, from 2019.

title: Jerusalem Wineries 2016 3400 Premium Dry White (Samson)
description: This wine offers a bouquet of grapefruit and lime zest followed by flavors of chirimoya and guava. Grapefruit flavors return to the palate just in time for a zippy finish.

title: Johan 2015 Grüner Veltliner (Willamette Valley)
description: This estate features biodynamically grown fruit and artisanal winemaking practices. This wine is tart and focused in snappy lemon, orange and pineapple flavors.

title: LangeTwins 2013 Midnight Reserve Red (Lodi)
description: This wine has a nice oomph of blackberry flavor and full enough body to carry it well. It feels rich and velvety on the palate and a generous layer of fine tannins doesn't get heavy.

title: Leone de Castris 2016 Messapia Verdeca (Salento)
description: Lemon balm, herbs and citrus blossom aromas show a nice, clean intensity on the nose. Bright on the palate, with a bit of weight and roundness, citrus pith and fleshy yellow apple flavors meld with more balmy, herbal notes.

title: Luna Beberide 2016 Godello (Bierzo)
description: Mild white-fruit aromas suggest peach juice. This Godello is both plump and citrusy in feel. Generic citrus flavors are closest to orange. This is a touch bitter and slightly oxidized on the finish, so drink now.

title: Masseria Altemura 2016 Fiano (Salento)
description: Lemon and hay aromas carry delicate pollen and floral tones on the nose. Medium in weight and acidity, the palate is yellow-fruit driven, with a grapefruit zest vein of acidity.

title: McManis 2016 Petite Sirah (California)
description: This is a big bold wine that lays on the oak flavor without restraint. A strong aroma of cedar and baking spices is followed by very concentrated dark-fruit flavors and spicy charred oak flavors. It is quite tannic and almost thick in texture, giving plenty of grip on the palate.

title: Minimus 2016 Vitae Springs Vineyard Grüner Veltliner (Willamette Valley)
description: Compared to the 2015 vintage which retained its liveliness, this new vintage seems woody and oxidized. It's a natural wine, and those can sometimes thrill tasters willing to stretch out a bit. Here, it's soft and slightly flat, with flavors of mashed fruits. Drink up.

title: Mirassou 2016 Moscato (California)
description: Light floral and peach aromas lead to a lively palate full of fresh fruit, lychees, and honey while a subtle fizz helps balance out considerable sweetness. It's a charming, light wine that's easy to swallow.

title: Quinta de Chocapalha 2016 Arinto (Lisboa)
description: Very much the local white grape, Arinto benefits from the relatively cool climate of the region to give a delicious, crisp wine. It is aromatic, full of citrus flavors with a zesty, mineral edge. Drink this wine now.

title: Ram 2015 Tempranillo (Umpqua Valley)
description: The Delfino vineyard was the source for these grapes, a mix of two clones. It captures a bit of the varietal character, with spicy, toasty notes around pale cherry fruit. In the finish, some chalky acids dominate.

title: Rento 2014  Ribera del Duero
description: Baked, raisiny aromas are dull and soft. Following that lead, this wine is jammy and lacking in verve. Flavors of prune, raisin and spice cake finish smooth and easy, with almost no acidity.

title: Rosemont 2015 Syrah (Virginia)
description: This wine is fresh with raspberries, rooibos, red plum and cedar. Rooibos is the star of the show in terms of flavors. While not compex, it has great acidity and silky tannins that translate to a long, lush finish.

title: San Marzano 2013 Talò  (Primitivo di Manduria)
description: There's plenty to enjoy about this lighter-than-average Primitivo. It's ripe and spicy, with a strong showing of bramble berries and anise. A soft, pliable feel make it immediately appealing.

title: Schmitt Söhne 2016 Crisp and Fruity Riesling (Rheinhessen)
description: While closed on the nose, the palate of this easy-drinking Riesling is plump in tones of juicy yellow peach and citrus. It's a lively, mouthwatering sip offering just a touch of bitter herb on the finish. Drink now through 2019.

title: Seacampo 2016 Casa Américo Rosé (Dão)
description: Vineyards close to Portugal's highest mountain range give this wine a crisp, cool character. A blend of Touriga Nacional and Alfrocheiro, it is fruity with red currants and plenty of acidity. The wine is ready to drink.

title: Shelburne 2014 Reserve Marquette (Vermont)
description: Smoky, earthy aromas are cloaked by red- and black-fruit intensity on the nose. The palate brings ripe berry flavors boosted by leather, cedar and allspice, while the tannins are grippy and spicy but cut through by a vein of acidity. Tangy currant and allspice tones carry through the finish.

title: Shelburne 2015 Riesling (Vermont)
description: Aromas of orange-blossom honey, peach and lemon zest waft from the glass. The palate shows clementine, ripe white peach and lemon juice, with a crushed rock minerality. The sweetness is balanced by a bright backbone of acidity leading to a clean lemony finish.
